bibl.title: Cablegram from John J. Moran to William F. King, September 7, 1933

div1.p: Moran sends word that he is unable to attend the meeting.

div1.head: Cablegram from John J. Moran to William F. King, September 7, 1933
div1.opener:
141 words
#6.27
Form 1259 HV
WESTERN UNION
WESTERN UNION
CABLEGRAMA
NEWCOMB CARLTON, PRESIDENT
J. C. WILLEVER, FIRST VICE-PRESIDENT
OFICINA PRINCIPAL: PI Y MARGALL
(OBISPO) 49, ESQUINA A CUBA.
TELEFONO No. {M-9901
{A-2111
{A-2112
Envíese el sigulente cablegrama con sujecion á las condiciones
del dorso que se aceptan por el presente.
Havana, Sept. 7, 1933.
DOCTOR WILLIAM F. KING
225 WIMMER BUILDING
INDIANAPOLIS INDIANA
div1.p:
HAD HOPED TO BE WITH YOU IN PERSON FOR WALTER REED MEMORIAL SESSION STOP
UNSETTLED CONDITIONS IN CUBA HOWEVER PRECLUDE MY PRESENCE WITH YOU EXCEPT
IN SPIRIT STOP TO ME IT WOULD HAVE BEEN A SIGNAL HONOR INDEED TO PERSONALLY
CONVEY TO THE DELEGATES OF THE AMERICAN PUBLIC HEALTH ASSOCIATION MY
PERSONAL RECOLLECTIONS OF THAT GREAT CONTRIBUTOR TO MEDICAL SCIENCE AND
BENEFACTOR OF HUMANITY WALTER REED WHOSE MEMORY I REVERE STOP IT WAS A
RARE HONOR INDEED TO HAVE KNOWN AND BEEN ASSOCIATED WITH WALTER REED AND
THE MARTYR LAZEAR STOP REMEMBER ME KINDLY TO THE SURVIVORS WHO MAY BE
PRESENT AT THE MEETING AS WELL AS TO THAT UNTIRING AND UNDISMAYED CHAMPION
OF OUR CAUSE OVER A PERIOD OF TWENTYFIVE YEARS GENERAL KEAN STOP MY SINCERE
THANKS FOR YOUR INVITATION
div1.closer:
MORAN Con cargo a
Cia. Sunoco de Cuba, S. A.,
Ave. Menocal 102-A (entre San Rafael y San José)
